results.title: Hunters and collectors: the way to go out
results.creator_credit: Andrew de Groot, Julie Stone and Human Fraility
results.brief_description: Presents a compilation of film clips and live tracks featuring the work of the band The Hunters and collectors. The filmclips comprise: “Talking to a stranger”, “Lumps of lead”, “Judas sheep”. Live traks include “The Way to go out”, “The Slab”, “Throw your arms around me”, “I couldnt give it to you”, “Chalkie”, “The Umbeliever”, “Carry me”, “I believe”.

results.title: Hungry angels
results.creator_credit: Marcel Reichenbach, Carlos M. Monson Malice and Reimon Productions
results.brief_description: Instructional film dealing with issue of malnutrition. Follows cases of three children - Maria, born to country peasants; Pedro, child of an urban single mother; and Carlos, the baby of a middle-class couple. As a result of poverty and ignorance, the first two children grow up constantly ill with dysentry and other ailments until, several years later, they are taken to hospital, close to death. The third child is fed well,has regular checkups and grows up healthy and happy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marcel Reichenbach, Carlos M. Monson Malice and Reimon Productions

results.title: Human rights video kit. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Keith Saggers and Education Department of Western Australia
results.brief_description: Highlights the problems associated with the protection of basic human rights as experienced trough the work of Ammesty International and similar organizations. Part 1 Dramatizes what it would be like to be an adolescent whose human rights were completely removed. Part 2 Provides a case history of a person detained without reason for helping student dissenters.

results.title: Human beginnings
results.creator_credit: University of Oregon and Eddie Albert Productions
results.brief_description: The film opens showing a class of six-year-old boys and girls working out, through drawing and clay models, their ideas of how a baby grows inside its mother. Each child holds up their drawing and explains to the others what it means to them. The film indicates that all the children have a sound basic idea about human growth and the value of discussion with caring adults.

results.title: Human aggression (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Follows the activities of a youth gang, showing how aggression is used to assert dominance and territoriality; is provoked by frustration; and is displaced onto others. The frustration-aggression hypothesis is discussed and demonstrated in a laboratory experiment. Modifications to the hypothesis point to frustration as a key element in provoking aggression. Considers the importance of the psychological training of police who intervene in aggressive disputes.

results.title: How you see; How the telephone talks
results.creator_credit: E. Dean Parmelee, F. Lyle Goldman and Boldwyn Bray Pictograph
results.brief_description: Rudementary illustrations of the workings of the camera and how the eye receives the image. The workings of the telephone and how the machine translates sound waves and conveys to the receiver. Of historic interest.

results.title: How to use your video camera
results.creator_credit: Terry McDonald, Janet West, Bob West and Video Pro
results.brief_description: This video has been produced by television production professionals with the video camera novice in mind. It covers the following crucial areas to consider when attempting to create a more watchable and enjoyable tape: forward planning, camera technique, lighting and sound, and an emphasis on practicing often to perfect the techniques described. The specific techniques include; how to operate the camera effectively, how to light a scene, record the sound occurring within a scene, when to consider adjusting the camera’s colour balance, focussing, exposure, stability, composition of the picture, changing angles for interest and care of the equipment.

results.title: How to use the telephone
results.creator_credit: Michael Law, H M Treasury and Public Relations Films
results.brief_description: A training film made for use in Government (British) departments pointing out common mistakes in using the telephone and showing how a proper understanding of the relationship between caller, switchboard and extension-user can save a great deal of valuable time and energy.

results.title: How to use the reader's guide to periodical literature (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Roger Wade Productions and Nassau Library (New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Describes the scope, uses and features of this periodicals index, and explains the structure of the headings, arrangement and abbreviations in the entries. Presented in an interesting spy story format.
